data.description: Graduate internship program for students majoring in computer science and related fields who are interested in working at a national science research laboratory. While providing the opportunity to gain understanding of and experience with Fermilab’s computing for high energy physics, interns assist with laboratory research and development efforts to explore and enable the use of state-of-the-art tools and technology for the benefit of the science community.EligibilityEnrollment in a U.S. college or university graduate program in computer science or related field3.0 grade point average or above on a 4.0 scaleEligible to work in the United StatesApplication ProcedureBefore applying have all requirements ready. Once submitted, access to the application will no longer be available to upload any missing requirements.Online application – Application Walkthrough Video GuideResumeUnofficial transcript Internship DetailsProgram Dates: May 18, 2026 – August 7, 2026Application Dates: November 3, 2025 – January 17, 2026Offer Date: February 21, 2026Acceptance Date: February 27, 2026Salary: Depending on academic year Master (year 1) – $1,000 per 40-hour workweek Master (year 2) – $1,050 per 40-hour workweek PhD – $1,100 per 40-hour workweekAirfare/Housing/Transportation: Airfare, Housing and Transportation paid by the program if permanent address is more than 50 miles from host laboratory.Location: Onsite work scheduleDeliverablesOral presentationPoster presentationQuestions? Email Internships@fnal.govWhy Fermilab: Fermilab is America’s premier laboratory for particle physics and accelerator research, funded by the U.S. Department of Energy. We support discovery science experiments in Illinois and locations around the world, including deep underground mines in South Dakota and Canada, mountaintops in Arizona and Chile, CERN in Europe and the South Pole.Drug-Free Workplace & Pre-Employment Screening Fermilab is dedicated to fostering a safe, productive, and drug-free work environment. As part of the hiring process, candidates must successfully complete a background check and drug screening for candidates 18 and over. Employment is contingent upon the successful completion of these screenings.Equal Opportunity Statement Fermilab is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, and other legally protected categories.REAL-ID Requirement for access to Fermilab CampusFermilab requires all members of the public to produce a REAL-ID, or equivalent, to access the Fermilab Campus for interviews or career events. A list of acceptable forms of ID can be found here: https://get-connected.fnal.gov/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/REALID-Documents.pdf. If a candidate is selected for an interview but does not possess any of the equivalent documents, we may schedule a virtual interview. What To Expect Next:We’ll be in touch! If your qualifications are in alignment with the position requirements, one of our recruiters will be reaching out to schedule a phone interview to learn more about your career interests and goals. In the meantime, we encourage you to check us out on Facebook, X, Instagram, LinkedIn, or our About Us page.External Field
